section.title: What browsers does the JmolApplet run on?
section.p:
The JmolApplet runs on most popular browsers.
Note that these are minimum version numbers ... anything newer should work
Win32 (Win98 Second Edition or better)
Microsoft IE 5.0 with MSFT Java Virtual Machine
Microsoft IE 5.0 with Sun Java Plug-in 1.4
IE 5.0 is what shipped with Win98SE
Netscape 4.76
Netscape 7.0 with Sun Java Plug-in
Mozilla 1.3 with Sun Java Plug-in 1.4
Firefox 1.0 with Sun Java Plug-in 1.4
Opera 7.5.4 with Sun Java Plug-in 1.4
MacOS X 10.3.3 (Panther with update to at least 10.3.3)
Safari 1.2.1 (v125.1)
Mozilla/Firefox when properly configured to use Java 1.4.2
(see javaplugin.sourceforge.net)
Linux/Unix
Mozilla 1.2.1 with Java Plug-in 1.4
Firefox 1.0 with Java Plug-in 1.4
Konqueror up through 3.3 does NOT work many problems
MacOS 9
Netscape 4.78
very slow
MSFT IE
No LiveConnect
To check your browser try out the Jmol Browser Check

section.title: Which JVM should I use on Win32 Internet Explorer?
section.p: Install the Sun Java Plug-in from www.java.com

Jmol runs fine on the Microsoft Java Virtual Machine. However, Microsoft stopped shipping it in 2002 (?). Since Microsoft no longer really supports this product, we strongly recommend that you upgrade.
If you understand enough to ask this question, the you should understand that you should upgrade.

section.title: What is the deal with MacOS X?
section.p: Only Mac OS X 10.3.3 and greater with Safari v125.1 are supported. Up to that point there was no LiveConnect communication between JavaScript and Java applets.
Internet Explorer on Mac OS X not supported because it does not support LiveConnect communications.

section.title: I can see the display, but the buttons are not working
section.p: Are you running on a supported browser?
To check your browser try out the Jmol Browser Check

The underlying JmolApplet runs on many browsers. Unfortunately, many of those browsers do not support LiveConnect communications between JavaScript and Java. So if the web pages use JavaScript to try to control the JmolApplet, then it will not work on those browsers.

A partial list:
Anything on MacOS X prior to 10.3.3 with Java 1.4.2
IE on Mac OS X
Mozilla/Netscape on OS X
unless you have the javaplugin installed

section.title: The buttons are not working on Mozilla/Firefox on MacOS X
section.p: By default Mozilla/Firefox will use Java 1.3 ... and there is no support for LiveConnect communication between JavaScript and Java.
You must install the MacOS X java plugin from javaplugin.sourceforge.net

section.title: Is OpenGL or 3D hardware required to run the JmolApplet?
section.p: No special hardware is required to run the JmolApplet. The graphics engine is a z-buffer implemented in Java, and designed for rendering molecules. (In fact, designed just for Jmol.)
If you have a good graphics card then it will run faster, but it doesn't have anything to do with the 3D capabilities of the card.
